sub_title: Chief Operating Officer at EPEX SPOT
summary:
I am a leader, innovator and agent for change. I coach teams to overcome complex issues in rapidly growing and changing businesses, particularly those that require significant restructuring or growth. I am an all-rounder with a natural ability to create and lead diverse and high performing teams through a low-ego servant leadership approach. I have a knack for getting the big picture and strategy right, and then quickly overcoming the key hurdles needed to implement real change on the ground.

My experience spans blue chip and mid-sized (€100m-€70bn) companies in energy, utilities, strategy, operations, commercial, IT and trading. I drive results through empowerment, continuous improvement and measuring results (financials, customers, staff, and so forth).

As a Swedish and New Zealand citizen with 25+ years successful experience in six countries, I have a truly global mindset and cultural awareness. This, in combination with my ability to develop people and successful teams, has been a key success factor in operationalising strategy and delivering positive business outcomes.

Key skills: leadership, digital transformation, strategy design, change management, stakeholder management, project management, innovation, regulation, crisis management, risk management.

profile_positions.description:
As COO and Management Board Member of EPEX Spot, I have responsibility for the 24/7 market operations, IT team, project management, commercial/sales and business intelligence (BI). I lead a 225 strong team and have led a significant transformation to simplify the organisation, build effective teams and empower staff to deliver the vision agreed with the Supervisory Board.
•	Developing the people agenda to improve motivation, involvement and working relationships to help delivering positive business outcomes.
•	Instilling a customer focussed and commercial culture, including adapting pricing, sales, customer care and contractual management.
•	Reducing ongoing running costs by clarifying operational processes, measuring outcomes, investing in automation, introduce agile IT methods and approaches and working on simplifications and scalability.
•	Establishing an innovation and entrepreneurial mindset to prepare for future growth from the ongoing trend of decentralisation, decarbonisation and digitalisation in the energy sector.

profile_positions.description:
I was a senior strategist for the EDF Group (2018: €69 billion turnover, €15.3 billion EBITDA) at the headquarters in Paris, working closely with all business units and teams globally to deliver change and to progress the organisation strategically:

- Helped redefine the global EDF Group strategy for the new Group CEO, Jean-Bernard Lévy, when he arrived in 2014. The strategy aimed to by 2030 develop 50 GW of renewables, grow the international business by 3 times and innovating to improve customer service.
 
- Led the redevelopment of Group’s gas strategy, managing a team of experts throughout the EDF Group and the supporting BCG team. The outcome was to shift all gas activities to Edison (€505m 2016 EBITDA) in Italy, to create synergies and to streamline decision making. The subsequent implementation increased the gas business EBITDA significantly.

- Led the implementation of the strategy relating to the Group’s trading and market facing activities. The outcome was to divest the Group’s coal and LNG trading activities to the Singapore based JERA Global Markets to align with the strategy of reduce the focus on fossil fuels while at the same time maximising revenues and shareholder value.

- Contributed to several high-profile projects, including renewables generation, trading, and B2B sales business approaches in Europe, the US and UK. 

- Maintained senior European advocacy roles towards the European Commission and representing the interests of France to shape European energy, climate, CO2 and market policies while also keeping abreast of the economics and supply/demand outlook.
profile_positions.title: Director within the Strategy and Innovation Division

profile_positions.description:
I was that of a key influencer and problem solver, to overcome the complex issues that face a rapidly growing business in highly regulated and political markets that had just been liberalised across Europe. EDF Trading was one of the world’s largest energy traders which experienced significant growth, quadrupling in trading margins to 1b€ during the 2005-2011 period. Main achievements and responsibilities:

- Leading the operational readiness of EDF Trading to trade gas and power transmission capacity across over 20 European countries, helping to unlock new markets, business development opportunities and expansions to new countries. 

- Establishing and leding the regulatory and European advocacy activities to manage the international relations with authorities and regulators across Europe. This encompassed lobbying, compliance and M&A (e.g. the £12.5b EDF-British Energy and €550m EDF-SPE mergers). His team covered power, gas, CO2 and financial and derivatives.

- Acting as the external advocate, representative and promoter of the business and the industry interests at European level.
profile_positions.title: Head of Transmission and Regulatory Affairs

profile_positions.description:
- Led the Ofgem team that did the review of the economic case for National Grid making circa £800m of grid upgrades between Scotland and England. 

- Managed the multitude of economic and industry issues relating to the UK transmission grid. For example in relation to the transmission charging and initiating a project to set up a UK Offshore transmission charging regime to help development and connection of offshore wind parks.
profile_positions.title: Head of Electricity Transmission

profile_positions.description:
My responsibility was to provide advice to the New Zealand Minister of Finance as this related to two Government departments with circa NZ$280m and $125m turnover. Among other things, this involved:

- Being a member of the CEO advisory board for a $140 million IT project and a $45m sea floor survey project to enable New Zealand to submit its claim under the UN Convention of the Law of the Seas (UNCLOS). 

- Leading the Treasury input into a balance sheet restructure incorporating $400 million of fixed assets onto the balance sheet of one Government department.

- Advising, analysing and monitoring the budgets of the two Government departments, including budget approvals, budget bids and cash disbursements.

- Economic advise for issues relating to the New Zealand electricity markets, including the country’s reserve generation arrangements 

- Authoring the FID paper to build a 155 MW reserve generation power station. 

- Analysing the economic implications for New Zealand of Climate Change and the Kyoto Protocol negotiations.

This involved writing several scientific publications, presenting at international scientific conferences, computer programming, software development and significant and automated data analytics.
